Posts.Title: Stage IV mom loses custody of children judyfams agada

Posts.Content: cancersuks wrote: I was on abraxine for 2 rounds but had to stop that because the cancer was progressing in my liver; I'm now taking doxil and avastin.  The abraxine made most of my hair fall out, but I have enough that I can pull back and put in a clasp on top of my head but you can still see my scalp.  Twice while out with my Mom, we have run into younger women my Mom knows and she has said to me when talking with them, isn't her hair pretty.  Yes, both times, the women have had beautiful long hair and I feel so bad about wanting to scream why are you saying this.  She knows how bad I feel about myself now, I hate it.  I want to say, I use to have pretty hair until the chemo got to it.  I feel so ugly lately inside and out. Dx 11/29/2009, Stage IV, 2/8 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2012 05:42AM cancersuks wrote: This is going to sound real snarky, BUT, there is a Major metastatic BC support group in my area, and they meet  in the mornings during the week.  I still work,  I don't understand any group that doesn't try to understand the full range of needs of its community.  Yes, some of us with Stage IV still have to work.  I am the sole breadwinner, my treatments are 2x a month and other than someone telling me I have mets I feel pretty darn good.  Sometimes you just can't win even within your own community.

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2010 07:32AM cancersuks wrote: Katie, When I was doing chemo (CMF) all I could keep down was milk or milk shakes.  However, I understand about the metallic taste, I always told people to imagine bug spray because that's how bad it was to me. Couldn't keep anything down for the 3 days I rec'd chemo and afterwards; however, afterwards I made up for lost time even with the metallic taste.   Close to treatment I would stick to soups and food that is easy to digest, ice cream, jello, crackers etc.,

Posts.Content: May 18, 2011 11:36AM cancersuks wrote: When diagnosed with the reoccurence, I told my family and close friends and some people at work, since I was scheduled to be out for months.  After that, only in passing if the conversation turned toward health issues. Recently neighbors came by (husband/wife) and we talked about not seeing me for a while, I brought up about the car accident on top of my cancer reoccurence and she said something to the effect of "oh is that something we should have known."  I immediately said No, that I didn't go around telling people about the metastasis; however, when I told my mom, she thought the woman was saying, why are you telling us now about it.  In any event, I'm a pretty private person and I don't want people thinking I'm looking for sympathy, etc.,  I still look pretty normal so it wouldn't be a giveaway if I didn't bring it up. I'm not ashamed of it, I just don't feel a need to share with everyone.

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2012 01:40PM cancersuks wrote: Yes, I do it alone and I'm single.  My parents are older and while I'm sure my Mom would go to treatments with me, the current cocktail combination takes about 4.5 hours to drip.  I get benadryl and nod out and wouldn't want someone with me just sitting. A month ago, there was more liver progression and my oncologist took me off abraxene and to be honest, I really don't know what the new drugs are.  It sounded like a foreign language so my mind just shut down.  I still work and do all my grocery shopping and cleanning too.  I even mow the yard.  My hair on my head is still hanging on, very thin now and I have to wear it pulled back in a bun.  My eye brows gave it up though.  Other than the new drug and it making me feel like shite the first week, everything is still ok...

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2011 07:30AM cancersuks wrote: Lol and more LOLS, you all are SOOO on Point, it isn't even Funny.  Yes, the $300K Education, all means didley in the end, if she's got no common sense or bedside manner! My first go round in '97 w/ BC I was treated at Johns Hopkins, they let me fall between the cracks and my subsequent metatasis in '09, made me realize being the #1 hospital in the country really means zippo to me now. The doctors at JHU NEVER called me at home. I'm currently being treated at the U of MD Hospital System.  My prior oncologist (who I loved, called me at home on holidays, tracked me down over routine issues) left and went to a PODUNK hospital which charges 2-3X what my bill is at MD.  Not that $$ is everything, but at this point, I can't rationalize going into debt over the same drug and was only seeing him every 3 months, which was about to be extended to 6 months.  I see thIS oncologist on Friday and she's going to discuss some more treatments.  xoxo to everyone!!!
Posts.Title: To My Oncologist cancersuks texasrose361

Posts.Content: cancersuks wrote: Please NEVER EVER call and leave a message on my answering machine on a Friday evening stating you want to discuss my recent PET Scan; knowing that possibly I wouldn't get your message until LATE and would have to spend the entire LONG holiday weekend worrying.  Really I'm more angry than worried. You are a  dumba$$. Dx 11/29/2009, Stage IV, 2/8 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: To My Oncologist cancersuks texasrose361

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 11:35AM cancersuks wrote: Hi Everyone! Thank you so much for the kinds words and reinforcement...I knew something was wrong all weekend, my denial to lalala land just got shaken.  I called the doctor's office this a.m. first thing and was told my told my oncologist was out until tomorrow.  I went nuclear over the phone and told them to have the other doctor look at my tests and get back with me.  Within 15 mins. my oncologist called, very apologetic and said the answering service was suppose to kick in, after I dialed the operator Friday evening.  I can't  remember if I did that or not, but my other oncologist would have hunted me down to give me "normal" test results. She said the PET showed new cancer activity in my lymph nodes at the base of my neck and in the sternum in my chest. It just isn'f fair.  I'm sure some of that cancer activity was activated over this long weekend worryng.  At least its not in the major organs...yet. I want to go back to pretending I don't have cancer.
Posts.Title: To My Oncologist cancersuks texasrose361

Posts.Content: May 28, 2011 10:56PM cancersuks wrote: Thank you Jleigh, hilda, leprechaun, My oncologist who I loved move to another hospital and I followed him to the new hospital; BCBS told me it was still a preferred provider hospital but when I got my first bill, it was over $500 for my zometa treatment.  At the old hospital, my bill was only $180 for the SAME drug.  BCBS told me they allowed for geographical differences in charges for the SAME drug.  I cried my eyes out but I cannot afford to pay that kind of bill every month even for the doctor i LOVED, so I went back to the other hospital.  I don't understand why when I didn't answer, she didn't just think to herself to save it for next week.  I've tried calling the Office phone number and even her email account but my email bounces her email address back as unrecognizable.  No one is picking up at her office and refers calls to the hospital. This should be in some handbook for oncologists. My other doctor called me at home until he got me, even if it was late at night, he even called me on holidays.

Posts.Title: Surviving Metastatic Breast Cancer for 18 Years EnglishMajor 3littlegirls

Posts.Content: cancersuks wrote: Today sucks, yesterday sucks and tomorrow sucks.  Today I went in for pre-op physical and my internist thinks he found a lump in my left breast.  I just had a PET scan a few weeks ago.  I've had to obtain an attorney for work and am forced to sue because my job is playing hardball with me about my leave for treatments and accommodation.  I am fearful of losing my job, have tried to refinance my home twice but the appraisal reports came in low each time.  I asked to be admitted into a special program and  my request is over 30 days old and I have to submit a new package. The thing is I never kept copies of the old request because I've been winging it from home.  My medical bills are mounting up and it doesn't seem like my insurance coverage is making a dent.  I am barely keeping my head up and compared to others, I realize I don't have it as bad but when will it get better.  I am single and alone and all the burdens fall on my shoulders.  Why can't I meet someone that will make it better.  Everyone says they are praying for me but it's just getting worse...I almost want to say stop the prayers.  Today a woman called me about my mortgage and I told her what I was trying to do, she said she understood and I told her NO she didn't.  She didn't miss a beat and told me her daughter had died from cancer.  Not only did I feel worse for what I said, I realize that may be my condition too.  God seems to be missing today.... Dx 11/29/2009, Stage IV, 2/8 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: It never ends cancersuks pee

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2010 02:45PM cancersuks wrote: Thank you Ladies! You all are the Best!  I know you understand and your suggestions, shoulders and prayers really meant alot to me.  Being alone is so hard,  Sharon I so envy you and your date! Details please.... I haven't had a date in years and just wish there was someone out there for me.  Now facing additional surgery to my back, there won't be too many parts that are all mine. Yes, I'm going to sue my agency through the roof, can you believe I work for a Federal Agency! The only plus I can see so far is that my attorney is a cutie, however, 20 some years younger than me.  He's very smart and I hope we can prevail, this Agency has been horrific to me.  I would like to cry on his shoulders  :) The lady who called concerning my mortgage yesterday who told me that her daughter had died from cancer, also told me out of the blue, "keep the faith". Somehow, yes, we are all intertwined in this together...I love each of you.
Posts.Title: It never ends cancersuks pee

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2010 10:51PM cancersuks wrote: Thank you Everyone!  Yes, today I'm feeling better, I did have a good nights sleep the last couple of nights and it does make all the difference.  I love the poem, I've always been single and self-sufficent and probably sent the vibe out that I didn't need a man.  Since my cancer came back, I'm not so self-sufficient and notice that my guard is lower than it's been in a long time. I think the dyanamics are better now for meeting the "right" man, I'm more open and willing to be helped and to admit my limitations.  Irina I'm so sorry about your situation, you really put things in perspective for me.  In addition to the physical aspects of a cancer diagnosis, are the economic ramifications, the number one reason cited for backruptcy is a medical condition.  The laws need to be changed and there needs to be protection for cancer patients.  Some people are fired the minute their diagnosis is known  because of the insurance costs and time away from work.  Discrimination against people with disabilities, especially with a life threatening condition such as cancer is easy to do.  We barely have the ability to fight our disease, let alone our employer and the bottom line.
Posts.Title: It never ends cancersuks pee

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 06:40PM cancersuks wrote: Patti,  I'm so sorry you've been sick.  I had the same reaction with Zometa my first treatment in December.  The doctor gives me an IV of benadryl and percaset (sp) prior to the Zometa treatments now and I haven't been sick.  I also drink plenty of water the day before treatment and the day of treatment even when I'm getting the IV.
Posts.Title: zemata patti4511 southsider

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2012 03:08PM cancersuks wrote: You are not alone.  When my cancer returned my Federal place of employment went after me, they actually caused my cancer to return in the first place from the job stress.  Instead of being supportive, they were trying to find ways to write me up, lower my performance rating and do everything possible to get rid of me.  In order to protect my job,  I was forced to hire an attorney, who filed an EEOC suit on my behalf. This past February a male judge at the EEOC in D.C., threw my case out and it is now on appeal.  My attorney's are now representing me pro bono after $70K+ in legal fees.  When I think about work and what these evil people put me through, I get so angry.  I don't know what support from my employer means, I know it could have made a difference to me at a critical time. I found out last week the cancer is now in my liver.  I'm still working too.  Discrimination against those of us with cancer is the silent war you don't hear too much about.  I don't have a husband at home to support me nor has it been financially feasible to throw in the towel and walk away.  I still need to pay my mortgage and have health benefits. If you press forward legally, don't look back.  Sometimes it isn't about winning but letting people know you're not down for the count....  Sorry for my rantings, yes some of us still have to work.

Frankie, I would push on finding out what's causing the pain, that's how my spine mets were found.  My internist had been treating me for a pinched nerve last year when in reality I had cancer mets.  I would find someone who listens to you and orders another scan.  What if he's wrong....

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 07:41AM cancersuks wrote: I am on zometa and was just switched from femara to faslodex.  Had my 2nd series of shots last Friday.  I haven't noticed any changes except for being a little more tired in the mornings than usual.  I must always remind the nurse to freeze my tush before injecting the needles; last week the nurse forgot to put the freeze gel on first.
Posts.Title: Started Faslodex 3rings 3rings

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2010 10:01AM cancersuks wrote: Wow, that makes my blood boil, alot of women have to have treatment that does disrupt their work and yes, they are getting hell for it.  You supervisor was out of line for including lack of disruption as a plus to your performance.  Cancer is protected under the ADA.  Yesterday I had to meet with an attorney because my boss has denied me telework with my collapsed vertebrae, even though my surgeon asked if I could be accommodated that way until surgery.  In addition, my boss is saying my performance production is down, they are in fact trying to sack me.  I've worked for the Federal agency for 28 years and this is what I get. I'm sorry to rant on your thread but this stuff just pisses me off.  If I were you, I would just accept the comments but know that they are far out of line.  Your medical condition is private information and they put it on a public document...
Posts.Title: Review @ work - was this professional?Or called for? 3katz rayofsun

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 04:20PM cancersuks wrote: I believe they always know what their seeing; he's treating you with Taxol, that in itself tells me something...  My oncologist wants me to do a PET next Friday, I'm scared too, at this point I would rather not know...  I'm so sorry for you and naturallyred, I can deal with cancer mets in my bone, not sure I could handle liver or brain mets.  For that reason alone I didn't do an MRI of my brain.
Posts.Title: I'm 3c but I have a question? Billynda Billynda

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2010 02:17PM cancersuks wrote: I had the procedure done in December for a fracture on my spine.  Unfortunately in February I was riding in a car that was hit and totally collapsed the vertebra that was treated.  In April I had 8 pins and 2 rods put into my spine...I've just returned to work about 2 weeks ago.  When the surgeon did the spinal fusion, on the sample bone he removed, he could not find any cancer.  I'm still undergoing cancer treatment and my oncologist said I'm not cured but everything looks pretty good considering.
Posts.Title: Kyphoplasty for spine fractures mohonda Lynne

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2010 08:15AM cancersuks wrote: Hi Lowrider!  I've missed you and everyone here!  After surgery I was flat on my back and when I was able to get up, my computer didn't work at home...figures!  I was cut-off completely and really got depressed.  I'm back to the hell-hole (work), but it's good to have a computer again :) Mohonda, The procedure has stabilized my spine but it came with a price.  I have a huge scar running down my back, I had a masectomy with a free tram flap in '97 so my body is kind of looking like a road map now.  Don't mean to feel sorry for myself but I was more depressed about the scar then having the actual hardware put into my spine.  Every day there is some kind of back pain but my back feels better than it did prior to the stabilization.  I now do aquatic therapy which really helps me.
Posts.Title: Kyphoplasty for spine fractures mohonda Lynne

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2012 08:45PM cancersuks wrote: I still have my faith and beliefs, however, I haven't been to church in ions and admit having trouble praying.  My parents go to church religiously and are very active, I guess I appear to be the "lost" daughter to those at their church.  On Saturday I received this Easter card from one of the church members who knows my mom.  I didn't open it because I've received her type of cards before, and it just makes me angry.  Today, I opened the card and it was an Easter wish with information enclosed asking where I would be spending eternity.  I am a private person and grew up in the church but not this particular denomination.  I think you show who you are by the life you live not by sending tracts and other information.  To me, the card was questioning my faith and who I think I am.  I never said I was perfect.    I called my Mom and told her how mad I was and that this woman needed to stop sending me this kind of card, my Mom then said the woman had run the material by her first before sending.  This made me even madder,  my Mom told me to just throw it away, that she hoped I wouldn't make an issue about it and that she didn't want to bring the issue up with the woman because she was doing it from a good place and didn't want this woman gossiping about her at church.  I said, oh gossiping is so Christian and then my mom got mad and said this woman was going through alot.  Today, her son is having a 6 hour surgery for sleep apnea.  I said MOM, I would trade the cancer that's now in my liver (I never told her it had spread to my liver), for sleep apnea!  It just infuriates me how people in church are constantly judging and that their little crosses to bear I could swing from my pinkie.  Then I get mad at God all over again for the minor hiccups these people think are ordeals and then the vicious circle starts over where I go out of my way not to be around these kind of simple people. I didn't mean to hurt my Mom but don't understand, if I had a daughter, it wouldn't matter who it was, I would put them in their place if they hurt someone I loved whether they did it intentionally or not.  A simple card that says I'm thinking about you would mean more than someone's missionl of prosletyzing me.  I think I'm on the same team, even though I haven't warmed a pew in a while.
Posts.Title: On this religious holiday Fitztwins SophieJean
